title: on me by section 18 of the Road Traffic Act 1961 (No. 24 of 1961) and section
heading: 1.1.2: Pedal / hand
text_raw:
1.1.2: Pedal / hand 
lever condition and 
travel of the brake 
operating device 

Visual inspection of the 
components while the 
braking system is operated. 

Note: Vehicles with 
power- assisted braking 
systems should be 
inspected with the engine 
switched off. 

(a). Pivot too tight so its 
functionality is affected. 

(b). Excessive wear or play in 
mounting/bush. 

Visual inspection of the 
components while the 
braking system is operated. 

(a). Pedal travel is excessive, 
obstructed, or insufficient 
reserve travel. 

Note: Vehicles with 
power- assisted braking 
systems should be 
inspected with the engine 
switched off. 

(b). Service brake anti-slip 
provision is missing, loose, worn 
to the extent that it is no longer 
effective. 

(c). Brake control not releasing 
correctly. 

(d). Mounting is insecure, badly 
corroded or worn to the extent 
that the pedal can be moved 
from side to side. 

(e). In hydraulic systems, the 
pedal tends to creep down, or is 
felt to be spongy when held 
depressed. 

(f). In systems assisted by 
vacuum from engine, with pedal 
depressed and the engine started, 
no dip is felt in brake pedal. 

(g). Travel in the brake pedal 
indicates air in the brake system 
or brakes are in need of 
adjustment. 

Functional check 

(a). Malfunctioning or defective 
gauge or indicator. 

X

be purged by at least three 
free acceleration cycles or

within the vehicle 
manufacturer’s 
recommended rpm setting.

discontinued. Do not hold

rpm for any length of time.

EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations replace Schedule 3 of S.I. 415 of 2017 to provide for the 
introduction of eCall as a test item in the National Car Test and so give further 
effect in Irish law to Commission Delegated Directive (EU) 2021/1717 of 9 
July 2021.
